DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Baseline Disease Documented Checklist Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was a documented assessment for any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person conducted before the initiation of a clinical trial, a type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people, as part of the clinical trial list of items required.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Baseline Disease Documented Checklist
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the documented assessment for any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person conducted before the initiation of a clinical trial, a type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people, as part of the clinical trial list of items required.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical study.

Concepts.definition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical study.

Property.preferredName: Baseline Disease or Disorder Documented Checklist
Property.preferredDefinition: Baseline; an imaginary standard by which things are measured or compared.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Documented; furnished with or supported by documents.:A list of items required or things to be done or considered.

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.
A list of items required or things to be done or considered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.description: All required baseline symptoms (see Section 10.3) must be documented and graded

ReferenceDocuments.description: All required baseline symptoms must be documented and graded in the patient's medical record
